hobby.message: Urban exploring with that homebrew again?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me - In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: City's the city. Still standing. Still breathing.
I fly drones, keeps me sane.
Didn’t get far last time—too many patrols out by the rails.
Weather’s the least of my problems these days.
It’s alright, if you keep your head down.
I do freestyle drone flying, out in the industrial zones.
Got cut short this week—network kept glitching, some alert popped up.
Harder to relax lately, with all the system updates.
Doesn’t stop me, just makes it noisy.
It’s manageable. Takes more work to find quiet corners now.
I fly FPV drones for fun—old habit from before the wristbands.
Tried last weekend, but patrol activity was heavier than usual out near the yards.
Telemetry lagged—think it was BCI interference, not just signal noise.
Strange warning on my wearable, too. Never got that before.
City’s tightening up, you notice it in odd places.
Could be worse. I still get out with the drones when I can.
Most people don’t get it, but freestyle FPV flying—the technical flow, the control—best reset for my brain.
Last run, I hit the scrapyards at dawn. More patrols than I’d ever seen.
My signal got throttled, band flashed a compliance alert right when I punched a dive.
Feels like the city reads your intentions now, not just your actions.
Made it home, but didn’t really shake the feeling afterwards.
Times like these, my hobby’s half risk management.
Kind’s not the word I'd use, especially lately.
I picked up freestyle FPV flying after my brother vanished—needed something off the grid.
Last session, the city’s BCI flagged my flight path before I even finished my second battery.
Didn’t used to care out by the rails, but since the restored admins showed up, patrol density’s way up.
Got hit with system lag and an irregularity warning—never happened before Marek Halden died.
Sometimes feels like the system knows who’s hiding, even if you’re just flying for therapy.
Six months ago, you could disappear into static zones. Not now.
Suppose that’s how they prefer it: hobbies that don’t clear your head too much.
hobby_answer: Yeah, still dodging.
Don’t really go far these days.
Too many new patrols overhead lately.
One wrong zone, you get flagged now.
Not as fun as it used to be.
Yeah, still flying—carefully.
Barely cleared the rails last weekend.
Saw lots of new patrol drones lately.
Network started lagging in weird spots.
Feels like someone’s always watching now.
Couldn’t get lost in the flow the same way.
Yeah, dodging towers is half the fun.
Last week the signal was all over the place.
Patrols even in the old scrapyards now—never used to be.
Had a warning pop on my band mid-flight.
Supposedly for ‘zone irregularity’—pretty rare until recently.
It’s harder to fly without triggering some system flag.
Makes the hobby more like evasion practice now.
Yeah, can’t quit dodging towers—habit now.
Last run was different—patrols everywhere, not just the city core.
Even the telemetry felt throttled, band flagged me mid-flight.
That’s new. Think it’s tied to all this BCI reshuffling.
Feels like they’re clamping down since the admins got demoted.
You can tell who’s scared—fewer people out, more eyes in the sky.
Mostly I go for the off-grid zones, but even those feel exposed.
Keeps you sharp, at least.
Still dodging, always—frees my mind, you know?
Been flying since before the new BCI was rolled out.
Used to feel invisible out at the yards; now zone tracking hits hard.
After those Council demotions, signal interference is worse—intentional, I’d bet on it.
Band flagged me for ‘irregular activity’ last Sunday in a dead zone.
Funny, restored types move free. Old-timers like me get flagged.
Lost a safe route I’ve used for years—now monitored, just like that.
Makes you wonder what they’re swapping out behind the signal masks.
Hobby’s still worth it, but you need more caution than ever.
